segments.text: Thanks for offering to give me a lift . I'm looking forward to this party , but I didn't want to go alone .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Don't mention it . It's my pleasure . Have you been to one of these large , sit-down dinner parties since you got to New Haven ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , this is my first . Last week I went to a cookout 5 for new professors at Dean Barksdale's home . I took a taxi because I didn't want to be late . But I was the first one there .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'll bet you were a little embarrassed .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You're right . The invitation said two to seven . I was there at two o'clock , but most people didn't arrive until three or four . They didn't start cooking until five o â€™ clock .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Cookouts often start slowly . A two o'clock start means you arrive any time after two .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I was late getting back from the mall , but I'm hurrying .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Why are you in such a hurry ? They said , Dinner at eight , and it's only seven-fifteen . I don't want to be the first one there again .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Don't worry . We won't be the first .
segments.speaker: S2
